thread.title: Brett Favre moved by family of late fan’s tribute to iconic QB, Packers
thread.title_full: Brett Favre moved by family of late fan’s tribute to iconic QB, Packers

title: Brett Favre moved by family of late fan’s tribute to iconic QB, Packers
text:
Feb 20, 2017 at 5:18p ET 0Shares 
Brett Favre’s impact on fans of the Green Bay Packers is still felt years after his final game. The children of one Packers fan – Bill Snyder – decided to honor their father’s passing by taking out a full-page ad in the Milwaukee Journal Sentinel last week to thank Favre and the Packers for bringing so much joy into their father’s life. Here's a close-up of today's @journalsentinel ad. Share your memories of your favorite @packers fan at https://t.co/BE8dIOv2IX #GoPackGo pic.twitter.com/G8QO25PYFS 
— Greatest Packers Fan (@GreatestPackFan) February 19, 2017 
Word spread to Favre, who responded Monday on Twitter by sending condolences to the family and telling them how honored he is that he got a chance to bring Snyder joy during his life. Sending condolences to the Bill Snyder family. I'm honored to have played a role in such a joyful memory of his life. Warmest regards -Brett 
— Brett Favre (@Favre4Official) February 20, 2017 
Favre spent 16 of his 20-year career with the Packers, guiding them to victory in Super Bowl XXXI over the Patriots in 1997. The 11-time Pro Bowler finished his career as the all-time leader in a number of categories – including passing yards and touchdowns. But those marks have since been eclipsed by Peyton Manning.
